mythStatements.statement: HIV can be transmitted through casual contact such as hugging.
mythStatements.detail: Transmission requires exchange of certain bodily fluids under specific conditions.

mythStatements.statement: Modern antiretroviral therapy (ART) can suppress viral load to undetectable levels.
mythStatements.detail: Consistent ART adherence keeps people healthy and prevents transmission.

mythStatements.statement: Prevention and treatment are only needed for select populations.
mythStatements.detail: HIV affects diverse communities; prevention and care must be universal.
